Class SearchUtilTest

java.lang.Object
tests.SearchUtilTest
@TestMethodOrder(org.junit.jupiter.api.MethodOrderer.OrderAnnotation.class) public class SearchUtilTest extends Object
Unit tests for the SearchUtil class.

This test class ensures that the fuzzySearch and fullTextSearch methods function correctly by verifying their behavior with various inputs, including keyword searches and relevance ordering.

Author:
Dhruv

      public SearchUtilTest()

  • Method Details

    • testFuzzyFilter

      @Test @Order(1) public void testFuzzyFilter()
      Tests the fuzzySearch method with a basic keyword search. Ensures that the relevant item containing the keyword is found.

    • testMultipleMatches

      @Test @Order(2) public void testMultipleMatches()
      Tests the fuzzySearch method with multiple matches expected. Verifies that all relevant items are returned.

    • testFullTextSearch

      @Test @Order(2) public void testFullTextSearch() throws Exception
      Tests the fullTextSearch method with short text documents. Expects that documents mentioning "software" are returned.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during full-text search execution.
      See Also:
      • SearchUtil.fullTextSearch(List, String, java.util.function.Function)

    • testFuzzySearchLargeText

      @Test @Order(3) public void testFuzzySearchLargeText()
      Tests the fuzzySearch method with long text documents. Ensures that fuzzy search is not effective for large documents.

    • testResultOrdering

      @Test @Order(4) public void testResultOrdering() throws Exception
      Tests that results are ordered by relevance when using fullTextSearch. Documents that clearly mention "software" should rank higher.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during full-text search execution.
      See Also:
      • SearchUtil.fullTextSearch(List, String, java.util.function.Function)
